result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett L Hartley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Operation/Vehicle, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.10(1).
  • Homicide by Negligent Operation/Vehicle, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.10(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution to be determined at a future hearing. Bail held for determination.
09-14-2017 PER NOTICE FROM PARTIES, RESTITUTION WILL NOT BE REQUESTED, SET TO ZERO.

Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
09-14-2017 CASH BAIL APPLIED TO COSTS, PAID IN FULL.

No Contact with the victim's families unless authroized by agent. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Count 1

Dated December 12, 2018.  IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Dustin C. Haskell is relieved from further representing Brett L. Hartley in this appeal.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Case called for sentencing hearing.  Defendant Brett L Hartley in court with Attorney John Scott Schiro.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites minor correction to PSI.   Court makes/recites some corrections.  Laetitia O. makes statements.  Ronelle B. makes statements.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  James H. makes statements.  Attorney Schiro makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

78  MONTHS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  42 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  36 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victims' families unless authorized by agent
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  To be determined  -  restitution hearing set

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)



COUNT #2:   IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

78  MONTHS IMPRISONMENT      *Consecutive to Count #1*
  -  42 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  36 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victims' families unless authorized by agent
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  To be determined  -  restitution hearing set

COSTS:  $268.00   (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)
 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant Brett L Hartley in court with Attorney John Scott Schiro.  Timothy Suha and Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1 & 2 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 & 2 on amended information.  Parties wished to proceed to sentencing today, however, the court wishes to now order a presentence investigation due to the change in the offer and changes in the charges.  Court will allow any parties present today to speak.  Nicole O. makes statements.  Danelle O. makes statements.  Laetitia O. makes statements.  Ronelle B. makes statements.  Court orders a presentence investigation.  Court sets sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Brett L Hartley in court with Attorney John Scott Schiro.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for oral ruling-ruling from motion hearing held on 2/26/16.  Court marks DVD from 2/26/16 hearing as Exhibit #5.  Court receives Exhibit #5.  Court reviews/recites testimony from 2/26/16 and for reasons stated on the record finds probable cause existed for the officer to obtain chemical test of Defendant's blood.  Court finds Defendant voluntarily spoke to Officer Murphy and that no improper police conduct existed regarding Miranda rights.  Court finds that once Defendant did invoke his right to counsel, interrogations/questioning should have ceased and finds that any statements that Defendant gave after that point are supresssed.  Attorney Schiro requests one more status date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Brett L Hartley in court with Attorney John Scott Schiro and Attorney George David Kidd.  Timothy Suha and Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for Motion hearing. Officer Jim Murphy sworn in and testifies on behalf of the State. Exhibit #1 marked for the state. Cross examination by Attorney Schiro. Exhibit #2 marked for the Defense.  Re-direct by the State. Re-cross by Atty Schiro. Exhibit #3 marked for the Defense. Exhibits #1-3 received. Exhibit #4 marked and received for the Defense. Defendant is sworn-in and testifies on behalf of the Defense. Cross examination by the State. No re-direct by Atty Schiro. Closing statements made by the State. Closing statements made by Atty Schiro. Court will take matter under advisement and set for an oral ruling. Bail remains as fixed.
